trans-unit.source: Provides a collection container for instances of the <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref> class.
The <xref:System.Net.CookieCollection> class implements an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface to provide a general mechanism for handling collections of cookies.
For example, this is useful in the case where an application is designed to store cookies for multiple servers.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.CookieCollection"></xref> class.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Net.CookieCollection>.
Property
Default
Adds a <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref> to a <xref href="System.Net.CookieCollection"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref> to be added to a <xref href="System.Net.CookieCollection"></xref>.
cookie is `null`.
Adds the contents of a <xref href="System.Net.CookieCollection"></xref> to the current instance.
Each <xref:System.Net.Cookie> is read from the <xref:System.Net.CookieCollection>`cookies` parameter and added to the current instance.
The <xref href="System.Net.CookieCollection"></xref> to be added.
cookies is `null`.
Copies the elements of a <xref href="System.Net.CookieCollection"></xref> to an instance of the <xref href="System.Array"></xref> class, starting at a particular index.
The <xref:System.Array>`array` parameter must be one-dimensional with zero-based indexing.
The target <xref href="System.Array"></xref> to which the <xref href="System.Net.CookieCollection"></xref> will be copied.
The zero-based index in the target <xref href="System.Array"></xref> where copying begins.
array is `null`.
index is less than zero.
array is multidimensional.
-or-
The number of elements in this is greater than the available space from index to the end of the destination array.
The elements in this cannot be cast automatically to the type of the destination array.
Copies the elements of this <xref href="System.Net.CookieCollection"></xref> to a <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref> array starting at the specified index of the target array.
The <xref:System.Array>`array` parameter must be one-dimensional with zero-based indexing.
The target <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref> array to which the <xref href="System.Net.CookieCollection"></xref> will be copied.
The zero-based index in the target <xref href="System.Array"></xref> where copying begins.
array is `null`.
index is less than zero.
array is multidimensional.
-or-
The number of elements in this is greater than the available space from index to the end of the destination array.
The elements in this cannot be cast automatically to the type of the destination array.
Gets the number of cookies contained in a <xref href="System.Net.CookieCollection"></xref>.
The number of cookies contained in a <xref href="System.Net.CookieCollection"></xref>.
Gets an enumerator that can iterate through a <xref href="System.Net.CookieCollection"></xref>.
You should use an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator> only to read data in the collection.
Enumerators cannot be used to modify the underlying collection.
The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection.
When an enumerator is created, it takes a snapshot of the current state of the collection.
If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, this snapshot gets out of sync and the enumerator throws an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException>.
Two enumerators created from the same collection at the same time can produce different snapshots of the collection.
An instance of an implementation of an <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> interface that can iterate through a <xref href="System.Net.CookieCollection"></xref>.
Gets a value that indicates whether a <xref href="System.Net.CookieCollection"></xref> is read-only.
`true` if this is a read-only <xref href="System.Net.CookieCollection"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
Gets a value that indicates whether access to a <xref href="System.Net.CookieCollection"></xref> is thread safe.
`true` if access to the <xref href="System.Net.CookieCollection"></xref> is thread safe; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref> with a specific index from a <xref href="System.Net.CookieCollection"></xref>.
You can use this to iterate over the contents of a <xref:System.Net.CookieCollection>.
The zero-based index of the <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref> to be found.
A <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref> with a specific index from a <xref href="System.Net.CookieCollection"></xref>.
index is less than 0 or index is greater than or equal to .
Gets the <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref> with a specific name from a <xref href="System.Net.CookieCollection"></xref>.
You can use this to iterate over the contents of a <xref:System.Net.CookieCollection>.
The name of the <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref> to be found.
The <xref href="System.Net.Cookie"></xref> with a specific name from a <xref href="System.Net.CookieCollection"></xref>.
name is `null`.
Gets an object to synchronize access to the <xref href="System.Net.CookieCollection"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Net.CookieCollection.SyncRoot%2A> property returns an object that can be used to synchronize access to the <xref:System.Net.CookieCollection>.
An object to synchronize access to the <xref href="System.Net.CookieCollection"></xref>.
